channel.title: Making Npcs drop items depending on drop rate
channel.description: Ok i want my Hightraining place bronze, irons and steels all to drop dragon bones... every kill but also a rare like a draconic visage but idk how to add drop rate... but i cant get them to drop dragon bones every kill.

item.title: Making Npcs drop items depending on drop rate
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“s p i d a z, post:5, topic:346812”]eww
npcdrop.java with ints > and easier to edit, IMO

[code]
public static int Tzhaar[] = {6522,1621,6523,1619,6524,1755,6525,561,6526,562,6527,1621,6528,1755,1621,561,6568};

public static int RandomTzhaar() {
	return Tzhaar[(int)(Math.random()*Tzhaar.length)];
} [/code][/quote]

It may be, but my npcdrops.java isn’t set for that, and I don’t feel like editing that until I get more into coding JAVA again.
But ya, yours may be easier, I just went off of what was in my server that I used to use, so…plus, I’ve been off of coding for like 8 months and haven’t looked at code until like last week for the first time.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Npcs drop items depending on drop rate
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“emtscape, post:3, topic:346812”]this how mine looks

npcdrop = 1 1 6529 3 6529 4 6529 5 6529 6[/quote]
What is with the multiple 6529 IDs?
Use this example, only one item per line…

npcdrop = NPC id ITEM id amount droprate
It's not that hard...

Read full topic

item.source: Making Npcs drop items depending on drop rate

item.title: Making Npcs drop items depending on drop rate
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Open up npcdrops in your config folder (most likely). Find the ID of the NPC you want to drop something, and make it look something like

npcdrop = 2263 5510 1 9

The npcdrop = 2263 is the NPC ID.
5510 is the item ID.
The 1 is the amount it drops.
The 9 is the drop rate. 100 would mean everytime. The lower the number, the less the drop rate.
You need to edit those numbers, that was only an example.

Read full topic
